instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used on the rapid and accurate inversion of cadmium (Cd) element content in saline-alkali land?
Output: The past study used visible-NIR spectroscopy on the rapid and accurate inversion of cadmium (Cd) element content in saline-alkali land.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used on the rapid and accurate inversion of cadmium (Cd) element content in saline-alkali land?
Output: The spectral feature processing methods used were FOD transformation and OBC algorithm.

instruction: What metric was chosen to analyze and compare the model performance on the rapid and accurate inversion of cadmium (Cd) element content in saline-alkali land?
Output: The metric chosen to analyze and compare the model performance on the rapid and accurate inversion of cadmium (Cd) element content in saline-alkali land is the root mean square error (RMSE) and the ratio of the performance to interquartile (RPIQ).

instruction: What machine learning models were compared to the MSC-ELM model in the study on the rapid and accurate inversion of cadmium (Cd) element content in saline-alkali land using visible-NIR spectroscopy and machine learning models?
Output: In the past study, the machine learning models that were compared to the MSC-ELM model were random forest (RF), partial least squares (PLS), and extreme learning machine (ELM).

instruction: Can the FOD transformation and TBIs be considered as superior spectral feature processing methods compared to traditional methods in the past study on the rapid and accurate inversion of cadmium (Cd) element content in saline-alkali land using visible-NIR spectroscopy and machine learning models?
Output: Yes, the FOD transformation and TBIs can be considered as superior spectral feature processing methods compared to traditional methods in the past study on the rapid and accurate inversion of cadmium (Cd) element content in saline-alkali land using visible-NIR spectroscopy and machine learning models. The FOD transformation helps eliminate baseline drift and reduce spectral noise, improving the quality of the reflection spectra. The constructed TBIs effectively enhance the correlation with Cd content compared to using single bands alone, reducing redundant information and enhancing the spectral features. These methods contribute to more accurate and reliable predictions of Cd content in saline-alkali land.
